result.execSummary:
The defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for THREE DAYS time served.

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by APRIL 30TH, 2025. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on SEPTEMBER 15TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mauricio Antwon Evans

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Court ordered Defendant to serve 50 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for THREE DAYS time served.

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by APRIL 30TH, 2025. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on SEPTEMBER 15TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Mauricio Antwon Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 2 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing to proceed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Received and Filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Received and Filed.
Elements of the Offense/WIS JI - Criminal

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARED OFF THE RECORD.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant was not produced by ZOOM.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer, and requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense in need of an offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mauricio Antwon Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel advises the court he still needs discovery and an offer and requests an adjournment.
Court orders matter adjourned. Cse remains calendared in Br 30. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with C Griffin or Elizabeth Residence
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Mauricio Antwon Evans in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mauricio Antwon Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
